data.title: Therapy for my life.
data.text: People say this is overpriced, please go to McDonald's. They have a dollar menu. This is a laid back great place with relaxing music. The food is different and delicious. The wine is not New York selection but for a Arkansas little country town with a lot of farming and industry you can't beat this different, friendly quaint little bar/restaurant. If it is too slow, enjoy it.  Have fun. Enjoy the wine and relax as everyone else will be. Every time with my wife sitting next to me, a nice glass of wine, great food, I really wish to god they would go slower and time would stop then the great night would never end. Nice place and nice people. I'm glad we found it and will continue going.

data.title: Girls night out
data.text: This was my first time to go to Therapy. It's not at all what I expected. It was a quiet, relaxing place. We were able to enjoy each other's company and be ourselves.  We had a great time. I ordered stuffed mushrooms and bacon wrapped peppers. DELICIOUS.  So need I say more?  This is one of my favorite hangouts.

data.title: Great little find
data.text: We have visited this restaurant on several occasions. It is a small, little place with a varying menu and great wine. Entertainment is provided at times. Great place for a girlfriend night or date.

data.title: Downtown dining
data.text: Our favorite place to go out for a nice meal.  We love to pick a couple of dishes tapas style to share.  The sweet corn empanadas are wonderful!  We also love the baked Brie and strawberries.  They have some nice Arkansas wines as well.

data.title: Great food. Perhaps the best in town.
data.text:
Good atmosphere great food. Must try it if you haven't.  You won't be disappointed. This is a well
Kept secret. Fresh tasty food.

data.title: Bringing 5 Star European Tapas to Jonesboro
data.text: This restaurant is paradoxically small for the huge taste of its food.  I have traveled extensively and believe that the tapas I've had here may be the best I've ever tasted.  I highly recommend getting several tapas and sharing them with friends in a community style meal.  The price is a bit more expensive for the area, but the quality of the food is superb and the quantity is still more than enough for sharing dishes.  The servers are knowledgeable of the drink menu and suggest good wines to pair well with your dishes.  This place is an absolute must for anyone who enjoys finer food on an affordable budget.

data.title: Severely Overrated
data.text: We came here because several people raved about it. The music was great, but the restaurant could use more decoration. The meal (pasta) was good, but the menu is rather limited. Very few vegetarian options. The wine is way over-priced! The service wasn't great either.

data.title: Hard to rate...
data.text: The food at this adorable restaurant was delicious. But...service was excruciatingly slow. There were only two other tables so it was curious. I'd come back and let them know we were in a hurry!

data.title: Nice place to hang out
data.text: The food is a bit expensive, but generally worth it. The baked brie is to DIE FOR! The staff is always very friendly. I'd recommend Therapy to my wine-loving friends from out of town.

data.title: Nice atmosphere was great.
data.text: The  atmosphere was great, the food was overpriced for the quality and presentation. I ordered the Seafood Medley, there were two shrimp and half of the clams were not opened, it would have been nice to have a seafood fork. The Tuna was prepared great but the presentation was lacking, there was a red sauce spread over the tuna that lacked flavor, it could have been on the side along with wasabi and soy sauce. Joe the waiter/ bartender was great.

data.title: Diamond in the rough
data.text: Jonesboro is a small and un-expecting venue for a wine bar.  this is a cozy restaurant that had yummy options for dinner and a personable GM that made the experience fun..

data.title: Some of the best Jonesboro has to offer!!
data.text:
I have lived in several cities around the US so I am comparing this to other wine bars and I am taking into consideration what Jonesboro has already...
* Great atmosphere - the best for a wine bar...small, intimate and not too busy with random items on wall or other - you can tell they took their time at creating a look and added items that were made by someone's hands (wood work and other design elements).  
* Wine selection - I think it's average but the thing is...it's a wine bar in Jonesboro AR so they are already WAY ahead of the game - they are always trying to improve in this area.
* I don't think a wine bar needs to offer a "full menu" and I like the idea of just offering a few small app's with a strong bread/cheese selection - but now they have a full menu and I've heard good things lately with improvements in the menu/food - so try it.  
* As a small town it's something I feel adds to this downtown and we desperately need it so I support it when I can and I know the owner's put themselves into this place.  It's way worth supporting just because it's local AND it's just a bonus that it's a great lil hang out spot!

data.title: Okay, but probably will not go back
data.text: This place is the closest thing you will find to a wine bar in Jonesboro.  As a wine connoisseur, I do think that they present it as too upscale.  Most wine bars are relaxed and laid back.  The wine drinkers I know are not snobby, but just the opposite. The appetizers are overpriced (if you are looking for a meal, go elsewhere).  I paid $8 for mushrooms that tasted like they were out of a can. It should be a nice addition to the downtown Jonesboro area.

data.title: Will Return
data.text: Food, service, prices, company, all qualified as great Therapy on a cold rainy night.  Maybe a little more grain in the side bread, and some fiber filled veggies, but Please never leave Lisa.  A fantastic cook.
